title: Royal superfan spot major mistake in The Crown as it drops season three trailer
text:
A royal fan has spotted an apparent error in the recently released trailer for series three of The Crown.

The trailer, released on Monday, offers a glimpse at what fans can expect from the next installment of the hit Netflix show, which will see Olivia Colman take the reigns as the Queen and Helena Bonham Carter adopting the role of Princess Margaret.

However among the praise and excitement from fans, one eagle-eyed viewer noticed that producers on the show appeared to incorrectly dated a major royal milestone.

The clip stated that Queen Elizabeth's Silver Jubilee in 1977 took place 25 years after her 1953 coronation, however the fan insisted that it was in fact only 24 years.

On Monday Netflix show The Crown dropped it's season three trailer, giving fans a glimpse into Olivia Colman (pictured) taking over the role as Queen Elizabeth II

However among the praise and excitement from viewers, one royal super fan noticed that producers had incorrectly dated the queens coronation

A broadcaster in the clip is heard saying: 'This is Jubilee day. This is a day as grueling as the Queen's coronation 25 years ago.'

The viewer replied to the trailer: 'Interesting. The Silver Jubilee was 24 years after the coronation, not 25.'

One fan defended the show, arguing: 'It was 25 years it was in 1977, The Queen came to the throne on February 6, 1952, and her coronation took place on June 2, 1953. She celebrated her Silver Jubilee in 1977 (25 years on the throne)'.

However original viewer was quick to snap back: '"This is jubilee day," the speaker says and the subtitles read, "as gruelling as the Queen's coronation 25 years ago". Incorrect. The coronation took place 24 years before Jubilee Day.'

The clip stated that Queen Elizabeth's Silver Jubilee took place 25-years after her coronation, however the fan insisted that it was in fact only 24-years

The trailer shows Olivia, 45, and Helena, 53, taking over from Claire Foy and Vanessa Kirby in their respective roles and the clip was released early following a blunder from Netflix Japan.

It teased The Queen will face her darkest time on the throne yet as she battles the miners' strike, national security, sibling rivalry and family conflict ahead of her 1977 Silver Jubilee.

The solemn tone is made evident in the trailer which starts with the Silver Jubilee, marking her Majesty's 25 years on the throne.

The trailer also shows Helena Bonham Carter, 53, taking over the role of Princess Margaret, previously played by Vanessa Kirby,31

The trailer gave a sneak peak into the forthcoming season, and will explore the hardship faced by Britain in the 1970s

But behind the grandeur of the horse-drawn carriages and the glittering tiara, it shows the monarch questioning her role.

Bob Dylan's These Times Are A-Changin' plays in the background as she says: 'This country was still great when I came to the throne, all that's happened on my watch is that the place has fallen apart.'

It then flashes to the miners strike, police rebellion and the narrative: 'The country is bankrupt, our national security is in tatters.'

Britain was faced with hardship in the 1970s, with the country at war over the miners' strike in 1972 and again in 1974 during the Three-Day Week, when electricity was rationed to three days a week.
description: After Netflix's the crown dropped it's season three trailer, one eagle-eyed viewer noticed that producers on the show had incorrectly dated a major royal milestone, the Queens coronation.
